The claim was fact: checked by examining data from Senate expenditure reports from 2002-08, which provided information about congressional staff salaries.
The analysis of the data found that the: s payroll was about $15,700 less than the median salary for men in her office.
Another source: Buzzfeed, presented different data in 2015, stating that Hillary Clinton paid women and men equally based on salary data for full-time staffers who worked in the Senate office, congressional committees, and political groups.
The expert: s verdict mentioned that the claim made by the Republican National Committee co-chair, Sharon Day, was based on the allegation that as a senator, Hillary Clinton paid women less than men in her office.
